main event: On 21 May 1949, a report of a flying saucer was filed after it was observed standing still over the Hanford Atomic Plant in Washington and then taking off in a southeasterly direction at a speed greater than a jet fighter.
interesting points: The object was described as round and white or silver,At its estimated altitude of 17,000 to 20,000 feet, it was tracked visually and on radar but faded after about 5 minutes,A scramble of available aircraft was initiated but yielded no results,Reports of falling bits of paper, identified as advertisements for an Air Rodeo, were made in the vicinity shortly after the initial sighting,It was concluded that there were two separate incidents, one involving the sighting of the saucer and another involving the leaflet drop by a participating aircraft.
sighted object: a round white or silver object
witness description: Max Segoinns, an observer at the site
